channel.title: How to make scrolls readable?
channel.description:
how do i make a scroll readable?
like if someone clicks on a clue scroll or something
an interface pops up and gives them a clue
also
how to i make it so that people can only use an item on an object only once?
for example, i use a key on a door and if they try to do it again, it says "You have already done this!"

item.title: How to make scrolls readable?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

It’s a method which uses the packet for burying bones and other things, such as eating.
Basically everything that has an unusual function when you left click it.

So, alternatively, you could just edit packet 122.

Read full topic

item.title: How to make scrolls readable?
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

[quote=“bencorbett, post:2, topic:170645”]I’ve never made clue scrolls before, so i don’t have a clue about the first question.

But you can just set a variable, and make it check if the variable has been set to whatever when they use the item on the object.
Or - You could just remove the item when they use it, which would be the easy way.[/quote]for the first part… i was talking about… hmm

like if you click on a scroll or a book

it opens up a new interface that says something

for example… if I wanted a scroll to say “Happy New Year!!” when clicked on

for the second part… how would i add a variable?

Read full topic

item.title: How to make scrolls readable?
item.dc:creator: @bencorbett bencorbett
item.description:
@bencorbett wrote:

I’ve never made clue scrolls before, so i don’t have a clue about the first question.

But you can just set a variable, and make it check if the variable has been set to whatever when they use the item on the object.
Or - You could just remove the item when they use it, which would be the easy way.

Read full topic
